sentence.Network_en: It's the collision of disparate ideas that alters one's perspective.
sentence.Network_cn: 是迥然不同的观点之间的碰撞改变了人们的看法。

sentence.Network_en: The Telegraph puts the union in a historical perspective.
sentence.Network_cn: 《电讯报》从历史的角度对该工会进行了报道。

sentence.Network_en: It helps to put their personal problems into perspective.
sentence.Network_cn: 这有助于正确看待他们的个人问题。

jx.jx_en_mean: showing the right (or wrong) relationship between visible objects

means.word_mean: 价值观;思考的方法;感情
观点;立场;倾向;态度;脾气
远景,前景,前途,展望,透视图

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (in the sense 'optics'): from medieval Latin perspectiva (ars) 'science of optics', from perspect- 'looked at closely', from the verb perspicere, from per- 'thorough' + specere 'to look'

entry.tran: （尤指受到某种思想、经验影响的）思考方法，态度，观点，角度
entry.def: A particular perspective is a particular way of thinking about something, especially one that is influenced by your beliefs or experiences.

example.ex: He says the death of his father 18 months ago has given him a new perspective on life...
example.tran: 他说18个月前父亲的去世让他对人生有了新的认识。

example.ex: ...two different perspectives on the nature of adolescent development...
example.tran: 对青少年成长发育特点的两种不同观点

entry.tran: 正确/不正确地看待（或判断）
entry.def: If you get something in perspective or into perspective, you judge its real importance by considering it in relation to everything else. If you get something out of perspective, you fail to judge its real importance in relation to everything else.

example.ex: Remember to keep things in perspective...
It helps to put their personal problems into perspective...
example.tran: 这有助于正确看待他们的个人问题。

entry.def: Perspective is the art of making some objects or people in a picture look further away than others.

means.word_mean: 1. a way of regarding situations or topics etc.;

sentences.sentence: "consider what follows from the positivist view"

means.word_mean: 2. the appearance of things relative to one another as determined by their distance from the viewer

auth_sentence.content: You see the work world from a different perspective.
auth_sentence.res_content: You see the work world from a different perspective.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: You see the work world from a different perspective.

respect尊敬+able可以……的→adj.可敬的;人格高尚的
respect尊敬,尊重+ful有……的→adj.恭敬的,尊重的
re回+spect看+ive……的→回头看[自己]→各自的
retrospect[v.回顾,回想]+ive……的→adj.追想的,回顾的
spect看+acular……的→adj.壮观的,引人注目的 n.壮观的演出
respective[adj.各自的,各个的]+ly表副词→adv.分别地, 各个地
pro前面+spect看→向前看→前景

Sentence.sentence: What I mean by that is the current perspective of the digital textbook is it's an exact copy of the print book.
Meditation (静思) techniques, in contrast, can teach people to put their shortcomings into a larger, more realistic perspective.
If someone has a great sense of humor, were a son, it means that they are happy, socially confident and have a healthy perspective on life.
Obama's presidency viewed from a global perspective.

sentences.en: You can get a perspective of the whole city from here.
sentences.cn: 从这里你可以看到城市的全景。

sentences.en: We may get a clear perspective of the people's happy lives.
sentences.cn: 我们知道人民对幸福生活的展望。

sentences.en: She has drawn a good perspective.
sentences.cn: 她画了一幅很好的透视图。

jushi.chinese: 从这里你可以看到城市的全景。
